result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Green County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 2-5-2020 Court extends probation 1 year or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first. 2-11-2021 Court extends probation for 2 years.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, crime victim witness surcharge and supervision fees through probation as determined by agent. Misdemeanor court costs have already been assessed on deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Green County Jail Office at (608) 328-9598 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.  The Jail Office hours are 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. Monday - Friday.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the Judgment of Conviction documenting a DNA Surcharge.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52

Defendant to undergo anger management, domestic violence treatment, and any other treatment and counseling agent deems appropriate.

Jared Wayne Monte-Hayden, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
SPD - Warrant from a DPA. DE was a Colorado resident at the time of the DPA and failed to comply with some requirements.  Has been in custody for 28 days since arrest for a Wisconsin warrant.
ADA Kohl - DE has previously entered a plea.  DE has not attended reviews, not contacted DA office, not paid restitution, not complied with other conditions of agreement.
SPD - requests a DAPTC to provide compliance documentation and determine compliance.
ADA - requests revocation hearing.  DE was not compliant and had to be extradited for this matter.
Courts sets new bonds and for a DAPTC 11/7/17.
